{{For|those of a similar name|Paul Shaw (disambiguation)}} {{for|the classicist|Paul Shorey}} {{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox comedian | image = Pauly Shore is Dead Red Carpet.jpg | caption= Shore at the premiere of ''[[Pauly Shore Is Dead]]'', 2003 | name= Pauly Shore | pseudonym = The Weasel | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1968|2|1}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, California]], U.S. | birth_name = Paul Montgomery Shore | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Stand-up]], [[television]], [[film]] | nationality = American | active = 1985–present | genre = [[Improvisational comedy]] | notable_work = Host of [[MTV]]
Stoney Brown in ''[[Encino Man]]''
Crawl in ''[[Son in Law]]''
Bones Conway in ''[[In the Army Now (film)|In the Army Now]]''
Tommy Collins in ''[[Jury Duty (film)|Jury Duty]]''
Bud Macintosh in ''[[Bio-Dome]]''
''[[Pauly Shore Is Dead]]''
''[[Adopted (film)|Adopted]]'' }} '''Paul Montgomery Shore''' (born February 1, 1968) is an American actor, comedian, director, writer and producer. Shore is best known for his roles in several [[comedy film]]s in the 1990s including ''[[Encino Man]]'' (1992), ''[[Son in Law]]'' (1993), and ''[[Bio-Dome]]'' (1996). He also hosted a video show on [[MTV]] in the late 1980s and early 1990s. Shore's acting career has declined since the late 1990s; he has since appeared only infrequently in a number of films and has primarily focused on [[stand-up comedy]].{{cite web|title=Pauly Shore- Biography|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0001736/bio?ref_=nm_ov_bio_sm|website=IMDb|accessdate=2 February 2016}} ==Early life== Shore was born '''Paul Montgomery Shore''',[http://ca.askmen.com/toys/interview_150/166_pauly_shore_interview.html "Interview: Pauly Shore biography"]. AskMen.com. the son of [[Mitzi Shore]] ([[married and maiden names|née]] Saidel), who founded [[The Comedy Store]], and Sammy Shore, a comedian.[http://www.filmreference.com/film/88/Pauly-Shore.html Pauly Shore Biography (1968-)]. FilmReference.com[http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4196/is_20050717/ai_n14783544 Unknown page]. Findarticles.com{{Dead link|date=February 2011}} Shore was raised [[Jewish]],Meyers, Kate (July 23, 1993). [http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,307295,00.html "Shore Thing"], ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' and grew up in [[Beverly Hills, California]]. He graduated from [[Beverly Hills High School]] in 1986.{{IMDb name|1736|section=bio}} ==Career== ===Stand-up career=== Inspired by his parents' work in comedy and [[show business]], a 17-year-old Shore made his stand-up debut at the Alley Cat Bistro in [[Culver City]]. "Everyone else in school was filling out their [[SAT]] applications, but I just passed mine back. I knew I wasn't going to go to college."{{cite journal | first = G. | last = Beato | title = Behind the Weasic | date = October 1999 | journal = [[Spin (magazine)|Spin]] |volume=15 |issue=10|page=118 | accessdate = 2011-01-14 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ygXnnzAlaNQC&pg=PA118#v=onepage&f=false}} (Google books). Shore was mentored by [[Sam Kinison]] and opened several of his sets. While touring the comedy club circuit, Shore cultivated an [[alter ego]] persona, "The Weasel". "The Weasel" involved Shore speaking in a [[Valspeak|surfer parlance]], heavily peppered with [[dude]]speak slang such as "edged", "melons" and "grinding" as well as his [[catchphrase]], "Hey, BU-DDY."{{cite news | first = Jim | last = Sullivan | title = Hey dude, the Weasel is, like, the future of America | date = June 24, 1991 | agency = ''([[Boston Globe]])'' | newspaper=[[Spokane Chronicle]] |page=B5 |accessdate = 2011-01-14 |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=WhlXAAAAIBAJ&sjid=E_oDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6946,3010075&dq=hey+dude+the+weasel+is+like+the+future+of+america&hl=en}} (Google news archive) ===MTV=== Shore's big break came as an on-air [[MTV VJ]], a position he held from 1989 to 1994. At the height of his MTV fame, Shore had his own show, ''[[Totally Pauly]]'', serving as a host, most memorably on MTV's annual [[Spring Break]] parties. He also released a music video, "Lisa, Lisa, the One I Adore". ===Film career=== In 1992, Shore starred in ''[[Encino Man]]'', which was a modest hit. The film's success propelled Shore to star in additional personalized vehicles, albeit increasingly less successful: ''[[Son in Law]]'' (1993), ''[[In the Army Now (film)|In the Army Now]]'' (1994), ''[[Jury Duty (film)|Jury Duty]]'' (1995), and ''[[Bio-Dome]]'' (1996). All five films received sharply negative reviews, with the last three each holding a rating below 10% at [[Rotten Tomatoes]]; in addition, each of the movies grossed less at the box office than the one before. In 1997, Shore starred in the eponymous TV show ''[[Pauly]]''; the show was cancelled after five episodes aired. Shore makes a [[cameo appearance]] in the American [[rock music|rock]] band [[Limp Bizkit]] music video "[[N 2 Gether Now]]",{{cite book|last=Devenish|first= Colin |year=2000|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NklshARL7PMC&pg=PA148#v=onepage&f=false |title=Limp Bizkit|publisher=[[St. Martin's Griffin]]|page= 148|isbn=978-0-312-26349-2}} {Google books}.{{cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tMLetx7SjCw |title=N 2 Gether Now| format=Flash video| publisher=[[Limp Bizkit]] [[VEVO]] official YouTube channel}} as a pizza deliveryman, and a briefer appearance in "[[Break Stuff]]".{{cite AV media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpUYjpKg9KY |title=Break Stuff |format=Flash video |publisher= [[Limp Bizkit]] [[VEVO]] official YouTube channel}} In 2003, Shore produced, wrote, directed and starred in ''[[Pauly Shore Is Dead]]'', a semi-autobiographical [[mockumentary]], and in 2005 starred in the short-lived reality television series ''[[Minding the Store]]''. In 2010, Shore starred in ''[[Adopted (film)|Adopted]]'', which sees him traveling to [[Africa]] to adopt a child.{{cite news | first = Lana | last = Berkowitz | title = Pauly Shore takes a licking and keeps on ticking | date = July 14, 2010 | url = http://www.chron.com/disp/story.mpl/ent/7108640.html?plckFindCommentKey=CommentKey:cc39190c-6968-4088-94bf-7529b6566f94 | work = Houston Chronicle | accessdate = 2011-01-14}} In addition, he has several short subject films and multiple projects in the works such as his [[MTV]] pilot called ''The Shores'' and various projects with ''[[Funny or Die]]''.[http://www.paulyshore.com/site/?page_id=1001 About]{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}. paulyshore.com. In March 2018 Shore appeared as himself in episode 10 of the TV series [[Alone Together (TV series)|''Alone Together'']]. ==Discography== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Title !! Role !!
